text: I am using DifferentialEquations with an ODEProblem.  I would then like to drive it with the RobustAdaptiveMetropolisSampler to search parameter space.  Unfortunately, there are many parameter combinations which fail to find a solution with the ODE solver.  Is there a way to get a return value from these failed runs so that I can convert it to a 0 in the cost function?

elements.text: I am using DifferentialEquations with an ODEProblem.  I would then like to drive it with the RobustAdaptiveMetropolisSampler to search parameter space.  Unfortunately, there are many parameter combinations which fail to find a solution with the ODE solver.  Is there a way to get a return value from these failed runs so that I can convert it to a 0 in the cost function?

text: `sol.retcode` <https://diffeq.sciml.ai/stable/basics/solution/#retcodes> allows one to check if the ODE integration was successful.

elements.text: allows one to check if the ODE integration was successful.
